titleStmt.title: Momus triumphans: or, The plagiaries of the English stage expos'd in a catalogue of all the comedies, tragi-comedies, masques, tragedies, opera's, pastorals, interludes, &c. both ancient and modern, that were ever yet printed in English. The names of their known and supposed authors. Their several volumes and editions: with an account of the various originals, as well English, French, and Italian, as Greek and Latine; from whence most of them have stole their plots. By Gerard Langbaine Esq;
New catalogue of English plays
titleStmt.author: Langbaine, Gerard, 1656-1692.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Nicholas Cox, and are to be sold by him in Oxford,

notesStmt.note: One of two unauthorized issues published November, 1687; reissued by Langbaine a month later under title: "New catalogue of English plays", London, 1688 [i.e. 1687].
The words "comedies ... tragedies" are gathered by a right brace on the title page; the words "opera's ... &c." are gathered by a left brace.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
